feed.title: Gage Salzano — Portfolio
feed.subtitle: I'm a graphic web designer, or whatever you want to call it. I help people create brands for new companies and initiatives, conceptualize marketing campaigns, visualize and illustrate things and design websites. My goal is to always provide the best quality stuff I can for a fair price.

entry.title: 826CHI 2014 Annual Report — Print/Web
entry.content:
826CHI was looking for an annual report to showcase their achievements throughout the year.

826CHI was looking for an annual report to showcase their achievements throughout the year.

We felt the newspaper format was unique and hopefully encouraged more people to give it a second look when sorting through their mail.

We felt the newspaper format was unique and hopefully encouraged more people to give it a second look when sorting through their mail.

I designed and (jank-ily) built a website to accompany the piece for sharing the content on social media, email campaigns and things of that nature throughout the following year.

I designed and (jank-ily) built a website to accompany the piece for sharing the content on social media, email campaigns and things of that nature throughout the following year.

entry.title: 826CHI 2017 — Screenprint
entry.content:
For its second year, 826CHI held a fundraiser organized by my friend Alison. It's a poster sale with art inspired by student writing.

For its second year, 826CHI held a fundraiser organized by my friend Alison. It’s a poster sale with art inspired by student writing.

This print was inspired by marriage advice written by a 5th grader that is just as good as anything you could get from a guy that would take your money to lay on a couch in a loft somewhere downtown.

This print was inspired by marriage advice written by a 5th grader that is just as good as anything you could get from a guy that would take your money to lay on a couch in a loft somewhere downtown.

entry.title: Stuff For Friends
entry.content:
Some of the most fun you have as a designer is doing things for buds. You know what the client likes (if not you’re a terrible friend, jk) and they come up with really fun creative briefs.

This was a shirt and tote bag design that was created for my girlfriend because she says it a lot.

If people had taglines, this would be Shannon’s.

I got to draw some cocktails for Amy & Ben's awesome wedding. Then I got to drink a bunch of real ones and make a fool of myself on the dance floor.

I got to draw some cocktails for Amy & Ben’s awesome wedding.

Then I got to drink a bunch of real ones and make a fool of myself on the dance floor.

Katie had the best gift idea for her boyfriend: make his dream brewery come to life.

We made a brand, came up with beer names and drew the damn brewery all based on things she remembered him saying when talking about it. The logos for the beer flavors were inspired by railway company seals since the location he wanted to build it was next to an old train line that was converted to a public space.

Katie had the best gift idea for her boyfriend: make his dream brewery come to life.

We made a brand, came up with beer names and drew the damn brewery all based on things she remembered him saying when talking about it. The logos for the beer flavors was inspired by railway company seals since the location he wanted to build it was next to an old train line that was converted to a public space.

The screenprint was drawn at the exact location as he described it, even the taco truck in front is something he mentioned that would be awesome.

This is a shirt we made with the logo of the 606 Kolsch. I never got to taste the beer but I wear this shirt almost everyday.

My friend Natalie sought a business card for her antique dealing business.

So what do you do when someone asks you for a business card? Take forever and design an entire brand system. (Sorry about that, Natalie)

My friend Natalie sought a business card for her antique dealing business.

So what do you do when someone asks you for a business card? Take forever and design an entire brand system. (Sorry about that Natalie)

Casey & Monica are two awesome people that got married in a movie theatre built in 1903. It felt appropriate that their wedding invites were made to feel “letterpress-y”.

entry.title: Google Engage — Branding
entry.content:
Google Engage is a partnership created by … Google, for agencies working in search marketing that use their products.

This concept symbolized building blocks, inspired by the theory that “The whole is greater than the sum of its parts.”

Thanks for that one, Aristotle.

Google Engage is a partnership created by … Google for agencies working in search marketing that use their products.

This concept symbolized building blocks, inspired by the theory that “The whole is greater than the sum of its parts.”

Thanks for that one, Aristotle.

It’s tough in these situations where the parent company has such a well-established brand to come up with something that feels distinct, but still belongs.

That’s why the color was such an important part. It tied the whole room together.

The parts of the logo could be used to construct icons, layouts and other brand elements.

It’s tough in these situations where the parent company has such a well-established brand to come up with something that feels distinct, but still belongs.

That’s why the color was such an important part. It tied the whole room together.

The parts of the logo could be used to construct icons, layouts and other brand elements.

entry.title: YouTube Let it Out — Marketing
entry.content: As part of a pitch to YouTube to help advertise their advertising platforms, visual concepts were created to show how the campaign would look and feel.

entry.title: Glassdoor — Branding
entry.content:
Glass Ceiling was an online editorial concept to help encourage and promote advancement for women in the workplace.

The monogram was created to symbolize taking the next step in your career.

The monogram was created to symbolize taking the next step in your career.

entry.title: Gusto — Branding
entry.content:
Gusto needed some ideas to help push an internal rebranding effort.

Gusto needed some ideas to help push an internal rebranding effort.

We only had a couple days, so we employed a “shotgun” approach to generate as many concepts as we could.

We only had a couple days, so we employed a “shotgun” approach to generate as many concepts as we could.

One of my favorite ideas of the bunch was based on the “moments of Gusto” in the workplace.

One of my favorite ideas of the bunch was based on the “moments of Gusto” in the workplace.

Keyword is MY favorite idea, not always the client’s.

:)

We used organic linework throughout these concepts in order to feel energetic and stand out in an industry where everyone’s using sleek lines and geometric forms.

We used organic linework throughout these concepts in order to feel energetic and stand out in an industry where everyone’s using sleek lines and geometric forms.

entry.title: “Who Wants Love?” 2016 — Screenprint
entry.content:
My friend Alison holds a poster exhibit every year with 826CHI showcasing posters inspired by student writing.

The concept of a pony with a green mustache wearing a wizard costume was inspiration enough … I just drew the thing.

My friend Alison holds a poster exhibit every year with 826CHI showcasing posters inspired by student writing.

The concept of a pony with a green mustache wearing a wizard costume was inspiration enough … I just drew the thing.

entry.title: Assorted Logos
entry.content:
Here’s a collection of some brand identities I’ve worked on through the years.

The rotation in the "a" was meant to symbolize the constant syncing of data required to power the service.

The rotation in the “a” was meant to symbolize the constant syncing of data required to power the service.

Sometimes the logo designs itself. The "O" and "C" in the name OnCorps are overlaid to symbolize a donut chart.

Sometimes the logo designs itself. The “O” and “C” in the name OnCorps are overlaid to symbolize a donut chart.

We drew probably 1,000 trees before landing on this guy. Made for a real estate application to symbolize the network.

We drew probably 1,000 trees before landing on this guy. Made for a real estate application to symbolize the network.

For a money-management app, this mark combines two visual metaphors. One is a coin being dropped into a piggy bank, and the other is a sunrise to symbolize a new financial start.

For a money-management app, this mark combines two visual metaphors. One is a coin being dropped into a piggy bank, and the other is a sunrise to symbolize a new financial start.

This was for a parking app … Get it?

This was for a parking app … Get it?

My friend Tony runs a company in my hometown that tests electronics on things like military-grade helicopters and electric cars. I just cleaned up their logo.

¯\_(ツ)_/¯

My friend Tony runs a company in my hometown that tests electronics on things like military-grade helicopters and electric cars. I just cleaned up their logo.

¯\_(ツ)_/¯

entry.title: Power2Switch — Branding
entry.content:
Power2Switch empowers people to find more affordable energy prices.

Power2Switch empowers people to find more affordable energy prices.

The concept was focused on playing with the relationship between light and dark.

The concept was focused on playing with the relationship between light and dark.

The color palette was literally inspired by light, and that was paired with industrial revolution-esque iconography to animate collateral.

The color palette was literally inspired by light, and that was paired with industrial revolution-esque iconography to animate collateral.
